I had what seemed like rather a good idea a few weeks back. Building on some prominent findings in social psychology, I hypothesized that politicians on the right would wipe their bum with their left hand; and that politicians on the left would wipe with their right hand.

","index":1,"dest":"几个星期前，我有一个好主意。基于社会心理学中的一些突出发现，我假设右翼的政治家会用左手擦拭他们的屁股;而左派的政客们会用右手擦拭。","desc":"

Ludicrous? Yes – absolutely. But for once my goal wasn’t to run a bona fide scientific study. Instead, I wanted to see if any “journal” would publish my ass-wiping “findings”.

","index":6,"dest":"可笑？是的，一点没错。但是，一旦我的目标不是进行真正的科学研究。相反，我想看看是否有任何“期刊”会发表我的屁股“擦拭”的发现。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

For those who haven’t yet come across the term, “predatory journals” are becoming a bit of a nuisance in science. They actively masquerade as legitimate mainstream journals, often with similar layouts and names – although they very likely have essentially zero threshold for publication, despite typically claiming to operate with rigorous peer review processes.

","index":7,"dest":"对于那些尚未接触过这个词的人来说，“掠夺性期刊”在科学方面正在变得有点麻烦。他们积极伪装成合法的主流期刊，通常具有相似的布局和名称 - 尽管他们很可能基本上没有出版门槛，尽管他们通常声称采用严格的同行评审程序。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

Most academics will know the irritation of receiving multiple spam emails per day soliciting manuscripts or inviting one to join editorial boards of unfamiliar journals. Much more importantly, though, these predatory journals are undermining the credibility of scientific publishing because the research they publish appears to be largely unvetted.

","index":8,"dest":"大多数学者都会知道每天收到多封垃圾邮件的烦恼，这些邮件是征集手稿或邀请其加入不熟悉的期刊的编辑委员会。更重要的是，这些掠夺性期刊正在破坏科学出版的可信度，因为他们发表的研究似乎基本上没有被发现。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

So partly out of frustration with this situation, but also out of curiosity, I wanted to see just how low the bar for publication might be. This is the story of my “study”.

","index":9,"dest":"部分原因是出于对这种情况的沮丧，但出于好奇，我想看看出版的标准有多低。这是我“学习”的故事。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

Which hand do you use?

","index":10,"dest":"

你用哪只手？

","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

There is a well-known theory in social psychology – so-called unconscious social priming. The basic idea is that words or concepts can prime our behaviors. The best-known finding in this field is the report that presenting participants with words to do with old age (“bingo”, “knits”) made them walk more slowly afterwards compared to a control condition (although also see this paper for a more rounded perspective as several findings in this field of research have been controversial in their own right).

","index":11,"dest":"社会心理学中有一个众所周知的理论 - 所谓的无意识社会启蒙。基本思想是单词或概念可以激发我们的行为。该领域最着名的发现是报告向参与者提供与老年相关的词语（“宾果游戏”，“针织”）使得他们之后走得更慢，与控制条件相比（尽管也看到了本文的更多内容）圆润的观点，因为这个研究领域的一些研究结果本身就存在争议）。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

So it seemed to me that there was an obvious prediction for political science – specifically, that politicians from the right should wipe their ass with their right hand (and vice versa).

","index":12,"dest":"所以在我看来，政治科学有一个明显的预测 - 具体来说，右翼的政治家应该用右手擦拭他们的屁股（反之亦然）。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

But there was a snag to my theory. We know that the right side of the brain controls the left side of the body, and vice versa. And in a stunning feat of logic, I realized that the theory had things the wrong way around. Politicians from the right would surely wipe with their left hand, and those from the political left with their right hand. And as we shall see, this careful reasoning paid off handsomely.

","index":13,"dest":"但是我的理论有一个障碍。我们知道大脑的右侧控制着身体的左侧，反之亦然。在一个惊人的逻辑壮举中，我意识到这个理论错误的方法。来自右翼的政治家肯定会用左手擦拭，而政治左翼的政客则用右手擦拭。正如我们将要看到的，这种谨慎的推理得到了很好的回报。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

My (fictional) research assistant camped outside the Houses of Parliament and essentially stalked “MPs”. She used a large folder of pictures to identify these politicians’ left vs right leaning tendencies. And when a potential participant was seen on the street, the research assistant walked up alongside the politician, indicated that she was a psychological scientist doing a study, provided a brief consent form, and then asked which hand they wiped their bottom with.

","index":14,"dest":"我的（虚构的）研究助理在议会大厦外露营，基本上跟踪了“国会议员”。她用一大堆图片来识别这些政治家的左倾与右倾倾向。当一个潜在的参与者在街上看到时，研究助理与政治家一起走了出来，表示她是一名心理科学家在做研究，提供了简短的同意书，然后询问他们用哪只手擦拭了他们的底部。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

This yielded nine (fictional) participants in total, including “Boris Johnski” and “Teresa Maybe”, although one data point had to be discarded – that of “Nigel F. ‘Arage”. He, rather meanly, told my research assistant to “bog off” when asked the hand-wiping question. And so his data was necessarily excluded from the analysis.

","index":15,"dest":"这总共产生了9个（虚构的）参与者，包括“Boris Johnski”和“Teresa Maybe”，尽管有一个数据点必须被丢弃 - “Nigel F.'Arage”。当他被问到手擦问题时，他宁愿告诉我的研究助理“陷入困境”。因此他的数据必然被排除在分析之外。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

But that didn’t matter – because the data from our sample of eight fully confirmed the theory. Politicians do indeed wipe their asses with the contralateral hand. I could scarcely believe my eyes – but of course the statistics never lie.

","index":16,"dest":"但这并不重要 - 因为我们的八个样本的数据完全证实了这一理论。政客确实用对手的手擦拭他们的驴子。我几乎不相信自己的眼睛 - 但当然统计数字从不存在。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"
","index":17,"dest":"粪便研究的肥沃土壤。 （信用：ExFlow / Shutterstock.com）","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

Time to publish

","index":18,"dest":"

发布时间

","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

So I had everything I needed to write a manuscript. And I decided to submit my ass wiping findings to the first possibly predatory journal that emailed me. Hardly any time had passed and a publisher came over the horizon – Crimson Publishers. Soon after that, the manuscript was completed and submitted – I even added in an “anonymous” peer reviewer of my own, “Dr I.P. Daly”, who was none other than my dear and extremely witty colleague and friend, Professor Ryan McKay – and then things started to get really interesting.

","index":19,"dest":"所以我拥有了编写手稿所需的一切。而且我决定将我的屁股抹去发送给我的第一个可能掠夺性的期刊。几乎没有任何时间过去了，出版商来到了地平线 - Crimson Publishers。不久之后，手稿就完成并提交了 - 我甚至加入了我自己的“匿名”同行评审员“IP Daly博士”，他就是我亲爱的，非常机智的同事和朋友，Ryan McKay教授 - 和事情开始变得非常有趣。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

Having submitted the bogus manuscript, I soon got an email informing me that the manuscript was safely received and under review. Just a few days later, I was informed that it was accepted for publication. With a request for US$581.

","index":20,"dest":"提交了伪造的手稿后，我很快收到一封电子邮件，通知我手稿已经安全收到并正在审核中。几天后，我被告知它已被接受出版。要求581美元。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

I told the journal I couldn’t afford any publication fees. So they dropped it to US$99 (for “web hosting charges”). I was tempted – but I’ve learned that you should never accept the first counter offer. So I went for broke. And it turns out that the paper was so groundbreaking that they agreed to publish it for free: “We do understand from you [sic] end. As per your previous conversation, I had a session with financial manager and have decided to provide complete waiver.” It must have been a truly magnificent session with the financial manager. On contacting the journal for comment in relation to this story, my editor was told: “Coming to publication fee the authors who are insufficient with funds, we do provide waivers according to their request [sic].”

","index":21,"dest":"我告诉期刊我买不起任何出版费。因此，他们将其降至99美元（“网络托管费”）。我受到了诱惑 - 但我知道你永远不应该接受第一个还价。所以我去了。事实证明，这篇论文是如此具有开创性，以至于他们同意免费发布：“我们确实从你们那里了解了[原文如此]。根据您之前的谈话，我与财务经理进行了一次会议，并决定提供完整的豁免。“这一定是与财务经理真正精彩的会议。在与期刊联系以便对这个故事发表评论时，我的编辑被告知：“由于资金不足，我们会根据他们的要求[sic]提供豁免。”","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

And so the article, “Testing inter-hemispheric social priming theory in a sample of professional politicians – a brief report”, by one Gerry Jay Louis from the “Institute of Interdisciplinary Political and Fecal Science”, was published. (Note: the paper is no longer available on Crimson’s website. They swiftly removed it when The Conversation got in touch with them for comment on this story, saying: “As per our Editorial Board Member’s suggestion we have retracted the article which you have mentioned from our journal, as you can glance our website for your convenience [sic].”)

","index":22,"dest":"因此，由“跨学科政治和粪便科学研究所”的格里·杰伊·路易斯（Gerry Jay Louis）撰写的文章“在一个专业政客的样本中测试半球间社会启动理论 - 一份简短的报告”发表。 （注意：Crimson网站上不再提供该文件。当The Conversation与他们联系以对此故事发表评论时，他们迅速删除了该文件，并说：“根据我们编辑委员会成员的建议，我们撤回了您提到的文章来自我们的期刊，因为您可以浏览我们的网站以方便您[原文]。“）","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

Nevertheless, it seems by initially publishing my study, this publisher didn’t live up to its own peer review policies. On their website, they say: “The Peer Review Policy is the most essential tool in assessing the quality of publication process that analyzes, validates, and integrates new research findings [sic].” I received not a single peer review comment from the journal, far less a request to revise my manuscript. (The journal told The Conversation: “We do strictly follow double blinded peer review process for all the articles that we receive.”)

","index":23,"dest":"然而，似乎最初发布我的研究，这个出版商没有辜负自己的同行评审政策。他们在他们的网站上说：“同行评审政策是评估出版过程质量的最重要工具，可以分析，验证和整合新的研究成果[原文如此]。”我没有收到期刊的同行评审意见，更不用说修改我的稿件了。 （该期刊告诉The Conversation：“我们严格遵循双盲的同行评审程序，对我们收到的所有文章。”）","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

Some people have asked why they agreed to publish it for free given their business model is presumably built on extracting publication fees. I don’t have a strong answer to that question, but my hunch is that the waiver is just a cheap way to bulk out the journal in order to make it more attractive to other prospective authors.

","index":24,"dest":"有些人问他们为什么同意免费发布它，因为他们的商业模式可能是建立在提取出版费之上的。我对这个问题没有一个强有力的答案，但我的预感是，豁免只是一种廉价的方式来扩大期刊，以使其对其他潜在作者更具吸引力。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

Cleaning up the mess

","index":25,"dest":"

清理乱七八糟

","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

Why is this sort of thing a problem? In a nutshell, predatory journals are contaminating the scientific literature by providing ostensibly rigorous reports of studies that in reality are often far from acceptable. Work published in such journals is occasionally used in serious public debates, such as on climate change. They present a serious credibility problem for science.

","index":26,"dest":"为什么这是一个问题？简而言之，掠夺性期刊通过提供表面上严格的研究报告来污染科学文献，这些研究实际上往往远远不能被接受。在这些期刊上发表的工作偶尔会用于严肃的公共辩论，例如气候变化。它们对科学提出了严重的可信度问题。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

Of additional concern, it turns out that many academics actually struggle to identify the rogue journals from the bona fide. A recent piece in Nature makes this point only too clearly – many senior scientists have published their work in these outlets, and paid thousands of dollars for publishing fees. Indeed, the journal in which I published my hoax paper has authors based at well-regarded institutions like Rutgers, Princeton, and Florida State University. (I am not implying that their papers are necessarily bogus in any way: in fact, they often seem to be regular articles that might well have been accepted in more mainstream outlets.)

","index":27,"dest":"另外值得关注的是，许多学者实际上很难从真正的角度来识别流氓期刊。最近在“自然”杂志上发表的一篇文章清楚地说明了这一点 - 许多资深科学家已经在这些网点发表了他们的作品，并为出版费支付了数千美元。事实上，我发表恶作剧的期刊的作者总部设在罗格斯大学，普林斯顿大学和佛罗里达州立大学等知名学院。 （我并不是说他们的论文无论如何都是虚假的：事实上，它们似乎经常是在更多主流媒体上被接受的常规文章。）","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

I am not the first to publish such a hoax paper. There are several lovely examples already out there. My contribution may only be the unusual blending of political science and faecal hygiene (which is probably the main reason that this story ended up going viral on social media).

","index":28,"dest":"我不是第一个发表这样的骗局纸的人。那里有几个可爱的例子。我的贡献可能只是政治科学和粪便卫生的不同寻常的混合（这可能是这个故事最终在社交媒体上传播的主要原因）。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

But it’s clearly a message that can’t hurt to be heard by more academics, who might otherwise prop up these scamsters with their meagre research funds. And everyone else take heed, too: sometimes you don’t need a PhD (or even any expertise at all) to get yourself a first-author “publication”.

","index":29,"dest":"但这显然是一个不会让更多学者听到的信息，而这些学者可能会用他们微薄的研究经费来支撑这些骗子。其他人也要注意：有时你不需要博士学位（甚至任何专业知识）来获得第一作者“出版物”。","desc":"

null

"},{"src":"

Gary Lewis, Senior Lecturer in Psychology, Royal Holloway
